title: (x) Feldenkrais Method logo - Garamond BQ {Conor}
content:
working on a design for a Feldenkrais practitioner. Wondering exactly what font is used in their logo?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120083906im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Feldenkrais-logo-type_4897.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Feldenkrais-logo-type.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120083906/http:/typophile.com/files/Feldenkrais-logo-type.jpg) | 15.49 KB |

 [‹ (x) Excel logo (X is hand drawn) - Americana {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120083906/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19877 "Go to previous forum topic") [a script and a modern sans serif - Scene, ??? {Geoff, ???} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120083906/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19852 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alchion

comments.content:
Initial guess would be a cut of Garamond… I’ll investigate.

Close to _Garamond BE Italic_. [Sample here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120083906/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/adobe_lib/080250000.html).

Hard to tell as I don’t have it, so I can’t take a closer look.

BQ and BE mean the same thing: BE is the abbreviation for _Berthold_ and BQ stands for _Berthold Quality_.

On a general note — if you want to [test drive Berthold fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120083906/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/garamond-bq/italic/testdrive.html) just go to [MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120083906/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/MyFonts).
